heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 19 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (165°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 66.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 859 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 191.0m lower than yesterday, 589.2m lower than the past week, 858.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 572m minimum and 1380m maximum, with an average of 705.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1294.2m and 1563.6m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dim outside. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (95%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
